attributes.action: oppose compulsory ID Cards for student loans, before they're introduced nationwide.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
From 2010 onwards, the government plans to make it compulsory for anyone over the age of 16 to hold a biometric ID card in order to receive a student loan, or to open a student bank account.

A biometric ID card will cost students up to £100 and will not otherwise be necessary until 2012, and only then if you are applying for a new passport.

This is an attempt by the government to "blackmail" young people, especially students, into buying ID cards and is totally unacceptable.

rejection.details: The Government has not announced any such plans.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
